DOC.brief_title: Safety Efficacy Nateglinide Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Already Taking Insulin Glargine , Metformin and/or Pioglitazone Rosiglitazone
DOC.criteria: Male/female , age 1878 inclusive Type 2 diabetes , take glargine , metformin and/or thiazolidinedione 3 month prior screen , stable dos 2 month prior screen HbA1c 7.08.5 % inclusive Fasting plasma glucose < 240 mg/dL screen Body Mass Index 2241 kg/m2 Pregnant nursing Other investigational drug within 30 day screen Treatment antidiabetic medication metformin , glargine and/or thiazolidinedione History type 1 diabetes Abnormal kidney function History acute diabetic complication Congestive heart failure require treatment Myocardial infarction , coronary artery surgery , stroke within 6 month screen Liver disease , liver enzymes 3 time upper limit normal Fasting triglyceride > 700 mg/dL within past 12 week Acute infection condition may affect blood sugar may interfere interpretation study data Treatment corticosteroid Blood donation within past 12 week Other protocoldefined inclusion/exclusion criterial may apply .
